|Type_of_place=Town}} 'Taunton' is the county town of Somerset, England. The
town, including its suburbs, had an estimated population of 61,400 in 2001.

The town has over 1,000 years of religious and military history, and is now
undergoing a regeneration project. It has various transport links which support
its central role in economy and commerce.

Taunton is the site of Musgrove Park Hospital and Somerset County Cricket Club's
County Ground and is home to 40 Commando, Royal Marines. Central Taunton is part
of the annual West Country Carnival circuit. It hosts the Taunton flower show,
which has been held in Vivary Park since 1866. The United Kingdom Hydrographic
Office is located on Admiralty Way.
